title: BrightData Web Fetcher
description: Search Google with country/language targeting or fetch web content. For searches: choose appropriate gl/hl parameters based on user needs, plugin will create query variations and execute research pipeline. Defaults to US/English if not specified.

userSettings.name: serpApiKey
userSettings.label: BrightData SERP API Key
userSettings.description: Your BrightData API key for Google search requests.

userSettings.name: serpZone
userSettings.label: SERP Zone ID
userSettings.description: BrightData zone identifier for SERP API requests. Leave default unless using a custom zone.

userSettings.name: unlockerApiKey
userSettings.label: BrightData Web Unlocker API Key
userSettings.description: Your BrightData API key for bypassing website protections when fetching webpages. Required for content extraction.

userSettings.name: unlockerZone
userSettings.label: Web Unlocker Zone ID
userSettings.description: BrightData zone identifier for Web Unlocker API requests. Leave default unless using a custom zone.

userSettings.name: openaiApiKey
userSettings.label: OpenAI API Key
userSettings.description: Your OpenAI API key for content extraction and content cleaning via AI.

openaiSpec.name: brightdata_web_fetcher
openaiSpec.description: Search Google targeting specific countries/languages or fetch web content. IMPORTANT: When user mentions a country or language (e.g. 'Japanese news', 'German articles', 'news in France'), ALWAYS target that country/language with gl/hl parameters and translate the query to that language. Examples: 'Japanese news' ‚Üí gl=jp, hl=ja, query in Japanese; 'German tech news' ‚Üí gl=de, hl=de, query in German; 'French politics' ‚Üí gl=fr, hl=fr, query in French.

action.description: 'search': Google search with country/language targeting; 'fetch': direct URL content extraction

query.description: Search query TRANSLATED to the target language specified in hl parameter. If user asks for 'Japanese news today', translate to Japanese. If user asks for 'German tech articles', translate to German. Always match the target language, not the user's language.

context_question.description: The original user question in English to help determine content relevance during URL selection.

gl.description: Target country code. CHOOSE THE COUNTRY MENTIONED BY USER: 'Japanese news'‚Üíjp, 'German articles'‚Üíde, 'French politics'‚Üífr, 'UK news'‚Üíuk, 'US news'‚Üíus, 'Chinese articles'‚Üícn, etc. This determines which country's Google search results to target.

hl.description: Target language code. CHOOSE THE LANGUAGE MENTIONED BY USER: 'Japanese news'‚Üíja, 'German articles'‚Üíde, 'French politics'‚Üífr, 'Spanish content'‚Üíes, 'Chinese articles'‚Üízh-cn, 'Russian news'‚Üíru, etc. Query must be translated to this language.

tbm.description: Google search type: 'nws' for news (use when user asks for news, headlines, current events), 'shop' for shopping.

url.description: URL or array of URLs for 'fetch' action. Extracts content directly without searching.

start.description: Google search results offset (for pagination, e.g., 0, 10, 20).

num.description: Number of Google search results to request (e.g., 10, 20, 100). Note: Google typically supports up to 100.
